examples: muddled the brook with his splashings

definition: to befog or stupefy (see stupefy sense 1) especially with liquor
examples: The drink muddled him and his voice became loud and domineering.

definition: to make a mess of : bungle
examples: muddled themselves into the most indefensible positions

definition: to think or act in a confused aimless way
examples: She muddled along for a year before going to college.

definition: a state of especially mental confusion
